title: Employment by economic sector in Latin America and the Caribbean 2019
summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 3 lines denoting Agriculture, Industry, and Services. The y axis indicates the Share of total employment and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall Services is gradually increasing, Agriculture, and Industry are roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The ranking of the lines from topmost to botommmost is as follows: 1. Services, 2. Industry, and lastly, 3. Agriculture.
Throughout the period, Services generally had the highest Share of total employment relative to others with an average of 63.61, and it reached its maximum at 2019 with a value of 65.11.
Followed by Industry which ranks as the second topmpost line , with an average of 21.3 Share of total employment,reaching its highest point  at 2014 with a value of 21.8.
Agriculture mostly had the least Share of total employment with a mean value of 15.0, which peaked at 2009 with a value of 17.18.

max_summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 3 lines denoting Agriculture, Industry, and Services. The y axis indicates the Share of total employment and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall Services is gradually increasing, Agriculture, and Industry are roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of Share of total employment in descending order is: 1. Services, 2. Industry, and lastly, 3. Agriculture.
Throughout the period, Services generally had the highest Share of total employment relative to others with an average of 63.61, and it reached its maximum at 2019 with a value of 65.11.
Followed by Industry which ranks as the second topmpost line , with an average of 21.3 Share of total employment,reaching its highest point  at 2014 with a value of 21.8.
The botommost line, Agriculture,  has a mean of 15.0, and peaked at 2009.
The minimum Share of total employment about 13.94, occured at 2019 by Agriculture.
